snippet: Friends of Moner Mohammad Abusalha, who joined Syrian jihadis, say there were no signs that he was becoming an extremist.
abstract: Friends and family of Moner Mohammad Abusalha, American-born man who carried out suicide bombing in Syria, are trying to piece together how his passion for Islam and teaching children about the Quran turned into something more disturbing; Federal Bureau of Investigation is looking into how he became radicalized and whether he had connections to other Americans who traveled to Syria.

byline.contributor: Wendy Thompson contributed reporting from Orlando, Fla.

lead_paragraph: Friends of Moner Mohammad Abusalha, who joined Syrian jihadis, say there were no signs that he was becoming an extremist.

headline.seo: Friends of Moner Mohammad Abusalha Saw No Indications of Radicalization
headline.main: Seeking Clues in Man’s Arc From Life in Florida to Fatal Blast in Syria
headline.print_headline: Seeking Clues in Man’s Path to Suicide Attack in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
